message_1:
What is the median score of a class of 24 students if their exam scores are as follows: 
55, 62, 78, 80, 51, 70, 92, 64, 80, 85, 90, 77, 68, 55, 59, 75, 82, 66, 58, 73, 88, 67, 72, 89?
message_2:
To find the median score, first arrange the exam scores in ascending order:

51, 55, 55, 58, 59, 62, 64, 66, 67, 68, 70, 72, 73, 75, 77, 78, 80, 80, 82, 85, 88, 89, 90, 92

Since there are 24 students (an even number), the median will be the average of the two middle scores. The middle scores are the 12th and 13th scores in the ordered list:

70 and 72

Now, find the average of these two scores:

(70 + 72) / 2 = 142 / 2 = 71

The median score of the class is 71.
